page.title: 03TRANSPORT
page.content: Vehicle{transport}around Porlock varies from Landrovers and Tractors to horses and pushbikes.Getting around in winter with snow and ice is difficult and the Council use grit and snowblowers in an effort to keep traffic moving.People on the hills make sure their freezers are adequate and{homelife}is maintained.Many roads are narrow and steep.People fear {Porlock Hill}the notorious 1 in 4 as there's no by pass(although discussed )the only alternative route being 2 toll roads privately owned one by the Fortescue estate the other by Lord Lytton.In summer{tourism}brings many more vehicles this often causes con- gestion.Buses run from Porlock to Minehead also to Lynmouth.No{Public {Service vehicles}run private coach companies operate this service.
